"Steve Robert Irwin"

"A man who valued the lives of every animal"

A little about Steve Irwin

Steve Irwin inherited a love of large reptiles early on in life and shared his love and passion through his work at the Australia Zoo and his popular TV series The Crocodile Hunter. He was also nicknamed "The Crocodile Hunter" and grew up taking care and studying animals on his parent's wildlife park, and became a well-known figure in popular culture with his trademark khaki shirt and shorts.


Steve Irwin was a loving father and husband who dedicated his life to protecting wildlife and wild places. He accomplished this life mission through his wildlife documentary series The Crocodile Hunter, his world famous Australia Zoo, and his charity Wildlife Warriors. He was best known for his rescue and research work with endangered saltwater crocodiles, the closest living relative of the dinosaurs, now the largest reptiles on earth. Today we continue his mission by working to overturn recent legislation in Queensland which allows crocodile egg harvesting from vulnerable crocs in the wild to support the commercial leather trade. Steveâ€™s legacy will definitely live on.

-- Terri Irwin's thoughts on Steve's legacy

Here's a time line of Steve Robert Irwin's life:

  • 1962

    Born in Upper Ferntree Gully

  • 1968

    Irwin caught his first venomous snake at age 6

  • 1970

    Irwin's family started a Beerwah Reptile Park

  • 1979

    Irwin becomes a crocodile trapper

  • 1991

    Irwin becomes owner of his family's business and meets Terri

  • 1992

    Irwin marries Terri Irwin

  • 1996

    First episode of "The Crocodile Hunter" aired live

  • 1997

    Steve discovers a new species of turtles

  • 1998

    Bindi Sui Irwin is born

  • 2001

    Irwin is awarded the Centenary Medal for a lifetime of service.

  • 2002

    Wildlife Warriors: Concervation Foundation created

  • 2003

    Robert Clarence Irwin is born

  • 2006

    Irwin dies from stingray barb

If you want to find out more about steve, you can read more on his Wikipedia entry
